maml:description.maml:para: Internal function to convert a PSCredential object to an HTTP Basic Auth header string
The PSCredential object to use convert to a basic authentication Authorization header string
The PSCredential object to use convert to a basic authentication Authorization header string
The ODataType string to canonicalize
The ODataType string to canonicalize
Retrieves Cobalt retrieves entities from the Cobalt directory

Get-CobaltEntities retrieves entities from the Cobalt directory. You can specify an entity type using as well as an OData filter expression to restrict the returned entities. You can also list the navigation properties you would like to expand.
The Cobalt connection object to use for the OData operation

The namespace-qualified entity type of OData entity to retrieve. If you specify no ODataType, Get-CobaltEntities will return entities of all types. If you specify a simple entity type name without namespace qualification, Get-CobaltEntities will insert the com.viewds.cobalt namespace.

An OData filter string to qualify the returned entities. The OData filter is applied at the server and restricts the entities that are returned from the server to the client. Note that OData filters are not the same as PowerShell expressions.
An array of navigation properties that should be expanded
The Cobalt connection object to use for the OData operation

The namespace-qualified entity type of OData entity to retrieve. If you specify no ODataType, Get-CobaltEntities will return entities of all types. If you specify a simple entity type name without namespace qualification, Get-CobaltEntities will insert the com.viewds.cobalt namespace.

An OData filter string to qualify the returned entities. The OData filter is applied at the server and restricts the entities that are returned from the server to the client. Note that OData filters are not the same as PowerShell expressions.
An array of navigation properties that should be expanded
Retrieves a single entoty from the Cobalt directory

Get-CobaltEntity returns a single entity from the directory given its EntityUUID. You can also specify an entity type using the ODataType parameter to ensure the returned object is of that type, or to cast the object to a base type.
The UUID of the OData entity to get
The Cobalt connection object to use for the OData operation
The type of OData entity to retrieve
The Cobalt connection object to use for the OData operation
The UUID of the OData entity to get
The type of OData entity to retrieve
Retrieves a single property from a specific entity in the directory

When composing PowerShell expressions, it is sometimes useful to include a specific property value in the expression without have to explicitly read the object and extract the property. Get-CobaltProperty returns just the property you ask for.
The EntityUUID of the OData entity to retrieve the property from
The name of the property to retrieve
The Cobalt connection object to use for the OData operation
The Cobalt connection object to use for the OData operation

The name of the property to retrieve
